messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 436
messages.msgSnippet: ... oh no! but ... Aww, shucks.  Thanks for caring :-) Tamzin s birthday was on Wednesday
messages.messageBody:
<<<<--- In AlwaysLearning@y..., Pam Hartley <pamhartley@m...>
wrote:
> I was! :) I saw the unsubscription come through and thought,
"oh no!" but
> then you reappeared. <g>
>
> Pam>>>>


Aww, shucks. Thanks for caring :-)

Tamzin's birthday was on Wednesday (she's now 8!) and we had
an Hawaiian luau in the park. It was a blast. The only thing that
marred the day (for me) was the fact that my lower back muscles
totally seized up on Monday morning and I couldn't sit down (I
still only have two positions for any length of time - upright or
lying down <g>) so I had to spend the duration of the party
upright. I still had a great time though.

I'm off to lie down and stretch again - sigh.

Meghan

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 436
messages.msgSnippet: ... ourselves why we can t do something that we are deep down afraid we ll fail at or don t really want to do but think we should or would like to achieve
messages.messageBody:
>Most of us (if not all of us at times!) make excuses for
ourselves why we can't do something that we are deep down afraid we'll fail
at or don't really want to do but think we should or would like to achieve
without putting in the effort.

I think you make a good point Joyce - why do we put up these hurdles for
ourselves. I know I am doing that at the moment - I want to establish a
homeschool learning/resource center for teens and I know I am putting up
stumbling blocks. I don't have the money is the main one. I know there are
many people who would find a way to do this, to find the money and it
disappoints me that I am finding it difficult to jump the hurdle. Anyone
have good tactics for breaking down these barriers and moving from planning
to doing.

Jill
